content: spring wood shawl by denise e m bartels y arn lace weight i used madelinetosh prairie y ardage approximately 1550 yards n eedles i used size 2 3 0 mm needles but i knit very loosely d epth at center approximately 36 inches 1 copyright ©2015 denise e m bartels t his shawl is a large crescent that is knit from the top down it is not as complicated as it looks all the leaf motifs are the same they are gathered in branches that are all the same though the twigs between them vary the uneven distribution of increases over the whole shawl causes distortions in the leaf and branch shapes which i quite like t he branches are arranged in overlapping row the first row has two branches the second has four the third has eight and the fourth has ten branches the shawl has a top edging of seed stitch and two body sections that are divided by a single knit stitch that forms the spine of the shawl the chart for the body sections is divided up so that you only need to deal with two sheets of paper at any time and so the symbols are large enough for those of us with imperfect eyesight 2 copyright ©2015 denise e m bartels i used a tab beginning to this shawl cast on 5 stitches using the an invisible/provisional cast on i used barbara walker s r ows 1 5 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 s et up for edging body spine body edging r ow 6 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 pick up 3 stitches along the edge and then k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 the 5 stitches from the cast on for a total of 13 stitch r ow 7 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 yo p1 yo p1 yo p1 yo k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 t he charts start at this point as the row get longer the charts are broken up into more pieces so that they remain readable charts with the same chart number are all part of the same set of row and are knit in alphabetical order e g the first part of row 44 is on chart 2a then knit the row 44 on chart 2b and finish the row on chart 2c as laid out below a ll even row start with k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 which is followed by the chart row k1 chart row again and finish with k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 a ll odd row are k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 purl to last 5 stitches k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 double yarns overs on the previous row should be purled in the front and knit in the back of the stitch r ows 8 43 k1 p1 k1 p1 k1
